The War Memorial of Korea free entry is an important attraction dedicated to the Korean War which raged over the Korean Peninsula during the early 1950s There are six themed halls and a large outdoor exhibition area where you can spend several hours learning about the Korean conflict Note the museum is closed on Mondays  As you approach the War Memorial you will see several large outdoor monuments which set the stage for a educational it not sombre experience of visiting an attraction like this There are also numerous military vehicles planes vessels equipment in the outdoor exhibition area that are worth spending time to view before or after you enter the monument to explore the halls within  Exhibition rooms do a good job of presenting the war in a mixed variety of ways and medium; traditional text and figurative displays cased displays wall maps sounds of the war and even 4D experience of MacArthurs landing at Inchon In this manner there is a nice effort to make the memorial as accessible as possible to a younger audience who might not enjoy traditional war and military museums  At the War Memorial you will find expected lockers a cafe and gift shop at the War Memorial of Korea but no wifi unlike the various national museums you can visit around Seoul Photography is allowed throughout as well You can easily spend 23 hours here leisurely going through the exhibition halls learning about the Korean War  We very much appreciated our latest visit to the War Memorial of Korea This is one of those attractions that can have a real impact on visitors a place you want to return to during future trips to Seoul

The War Memorial of Korea were once the headquarters of the Korean infantry This memorial is the largest war memorial in the world There are 8 main exhibits in the War Memorial The visitors can learn all about the Koreans war history by visiting the war history exhibit You may also witness how the Korean military developed over the years Different kinds of weapons and military equipment are exhibited as well The larger equipment were displayed outside the building Many of the documents such as files and artifacts of the war are preserved in the storage room in the memorial This memorial gives an excellent insight on the history and current state of affairs in Korea There are nationalistic propaganda here and there but its a reminder of the suffering and brutality of war and what many had to endure Inspiring of what South Korea had been thru and able to develop in fast pace in to a modern society and dominates the world in term of technology cultural and economy  This is an excellent museum to visit if you like military things and like to learn about Korean history Entry is free The memorial gave me a new perspective on who were all involved in the original conflict and also the fact that the war is not actually over yet and its actually on a long cease fire Outside the memorial is great if you like planes and war ships

There is no glory in war only hate and pain for the ones left behind and the ones that remain Korea has seen more than its fair share of bloodshed sandwiched as it is between the two belligerent powers China and Japan What the Japanese did to the Koreans during their 30 some years of occupation especially to the women represents a gross injustice and is unforgiveable The writer of this review has been alive just long enough 47 years to know unforgiveable acts happen and the best anyone can really do is sit and endure the pain and count themselves lucky if theres someone to share the pain with them The Korean War Memorial is perhaps the most fitting tribute to the memory of the fallen and perhaps more importantly useful for us as the ones left behind should we or our children never know war first hand The monuments here are in a word spectacular The great bronze statues of soldiers and sailors are immense and the towering sculpture of an artillery shell has to be seen to be believed There are machines of war here too Planes and tanks and naval destroyers  many of them left behind by the United States after The Korean War The collection inside the building is extensive and you could easily spend a whole day here trying to take in everything  Or you could just see what you see and count yourself lucky that you came to such a place The sundubu jiigae beef soup from the memorial canteen is exceptional especially on a cold day and tastes particularly good when washed down with a cold beer Win or lose the memory of war is a two edged sword I hope Ill only ever know from a distance Worth remembering the first thing you learn in the Korean martial art Taekwondo is dont fight if you dont have to May we all find peace in our time
